text: Hey everyone, and welcome to this week's
news and community spotlights. We are
honored to bring you the premiere of the
multi-awward-winning animated short, New
Idea, created by Marco Bosnak and his
talented team at Funbox Animation
Studio. Anyone who has struggled to
squeeze a creative idea onto paper will
surely relate to this imaginative short
film. With the creative juices refusing
to flow, the writer, director, and
producer at Funbox Animation Studio
decided to turn the camera on himself,
figuratively speaking, and explore the
process of finding that elusive creative
spark. If this all sounds pretty meta,
that's because it is. The film is a ry
and ultimately inspiring look at the
trials and tribulations the creative
mind must overcome to capture lightning
in a bottle. Be sure to watch the
premiere of the film at
unrealengine.com/feed.
Coming to PC exclusively on the Epic
Game Store, Mongill Star Dive is a
cross-platform monster taming action RPG
that invites players to collect adorable
monsters while gaining their unique
abilities to use in battle. Developed by
Net Marble Monster using Unreal Engine
5, the game features a vibrant visual
art style while enabling players to
switch characters in real time during
battles to utilize tag skills, making
the mixing and matching of your party's
characters a compelling component of the
action. So, how did Net Marble Monster
leverage UE5's flexible material system,
sequencer, Unreal Insights, and Source
Code Access to deliver an expansive
world with charming characters while
offering a unique gameplay experience
each time out? We caught up with Net
Marble Monster founder and CEO Ken Kim
to capture his thoughts on this
cross-platform project. You can check
out the full interview over on the feed.
Based in Kov, Poland, Blubber Team has
quickly established themselves as
leaders in the horror genre with
acclaimed titles such as Layers of Fear,
The Medium, and most recently the Silent
Hill 2 remake. We had the chance to sit
down with a few members of the team,
including two of the game directors and
technical director, to discuss their
newest survival horror experience,
Kronos: The New Dawn. We dive into all
aspects of the game from setting and
gameplay to why Unreal Engine was chosen
for this project. How tools such as
Lumen and World Party
vision and optimize development and
memory budgets, as well as how the
team's previous experiences set them up
to tackle this new atmospheric and
stunning survival horror title. Want to
learn more? You can read the interview
in full over on the feed.
Join your local chapter to learn, grow,
and be inspired. Here are some upcoming
events to check out.
Now, let's jump into this week's
community spotlights.
Welcome to Cozy Cat Town by Shannon
Welsh. An endearing and warm fantasy
environment lovingly built in Unreal
Engine 5.5. With a clear focus on
environmental storytelling, we found
ourselves immediately immersed in this
meticulously crafted world. one that
beckons us forth to explore, investigate
the bulletin board, and of course, pet
the cat. If you love this project as
much as we did, you can find more of
their work, including a full breakdown
of this project, on their art station.
Dust Walker by Patrick Van Ruigian is a
striking character beautifully rendered
in Unreal Engine. With a commanding
presence and masterful attention to
detail, this character tells a story
without ever speaking a word. From the
weathered fabric of his cloak, the dust
and grime on his skin, and the multiple
arms at the ready, we can see the many
adventures already endured, and only
imagine the many more to come. Be sure
to let them know what you think and
check out more of their incredible work
over on their art station.
Step into the world of Foxo by Elsar
Games, a cozy online multiplayer game
built in Unreal Engine 5. Jump into a
relaxing world you can explore either
solo or with friends where you play as a
fully customizable fox. The small team
at Elskar Games is creating an adorable
world that is brimming with character
where you can customize and expand your
den, personalize your fox, collect new
clothes and furniture, adopt pets, and
enjoy a variety of miniames such as
fishing, swimming, and even downhill
racing. If Foxo looks as captivating to
you as it does to us, be sure to follow
the team and wishlist Foxo on Steam.
Thank you all so much for watching and
we'll catch you next week.
